summary.span: Provides a strongly typed collection for objects and implements the interface to support navigating through the collection.

span.span: Provides a strongly typed collection for objects and implements the interface to support navigating through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供了有关的强类型的集合对象。The class provides a strongly typed collection for objects. 它将存储内部中从零开始的数组的对象。It stores objects internally in a zero-based array. 您可以修改集合时创建的第一个，然后使用以下方法来添加、 复制和删除对象：You can modify a collection when it is first created, and then use the following methods to add, copy, and remove objects: - 若要添加对象，请使用， ，和方法。To add objects, use the , , and methods. - 若要将复制对象，请使用方法。To copy objects, use the method. - 若要删除对象，请使用方法。To remove objects, use the method. 您可以创建一个只读，该集合不允许添加、 复制和移除对象，使用静态方法。You can create a read-only , which does not permit adding, copying, nor removing objects, by using the static method. 返回的集合并方法是只读的按原样时所返回上访问属性从返回的对象提供程序。The collections that are returned by the and methods are read-only, as is the that is returned when the property is accessed on a object that is returned from a provider. 一个引发异常，如果你试图修改只读的通过设置的默认索引器属性或通过使用任何以下方法：A exception is thrown, if you attempt to modify a read-only by setting the default indexer property or by using any of the following methods: - - - - - - 使用属性检查之前调用上述列表中的任何一种方法的集合。Use the property to check the collection before calling any of the methods in the preceding list. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何创建集合，然后添加对象使用与其方法。The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection, and then add objects to it using the method. 是当前站点图，显示前两个层次结构级别的子集。The is a subset of the current site map, showing only the first two hierarchical levels. span.para: 方法允许实施者定义所执行的基础的标准行为时必须执行过程的对象。通过定义方法中，实施者可以添加功能到继承的方法而无需重写所有其他方法。具体而言，随时调用方法指通过使用集合接口。

The method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed when executing the standard behavior of the underlying object. By defining the method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. Specifically, the method is called anytime the collection is used via a reference to an interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你可以测试是否集合是只读的通过检查属性。You can test whether a collection is read-only by checking the property. 属性也会返回`true`时是只读的。The property also returns `true` when a is read-only. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用属性来测试是否集合是只读的还是可修改。The following code example demonstrates how to use the property to test whether a collection is read-only or modifiable. 如果`siteNodes`是可修改，`MoveNode`对其调用; 否则为克隆使用的创建`siteNodes`作为基。If `siteNodes` is modifiable, `MoveNode` is called on it; otherwise, a clone is created, using `siteNodes` as a base. [!code-csharp[System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1/CS/webform1smccs.aspx#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1/VB/webform1smcvb.aspx#1)]

span.para: 一个只读集合支持读取和搜索操作，但不支持， ， ， ， ，和方法，也不上的默认索引器 setter属性， 。
A read-only collection supports read and search operations, but does not support the , , , , , and methods, nor the setter on the default indexer property, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举集合本质上不是线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread safe procedure. 即使是同步的其他线程仍可以修改，这将导致枚举器引发异常。Even when a is synchronized, other threads can still modify the , which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程线程安全性，您可以锁定在整个枚举期间或者捕获由其他线程所做的更改导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes that are made by other threads.
